body.p: In revising IAS 38, the Board considered whether to retain for intangible assets with finite useful lives the requirement in the previous version of IAS 38 for the residual value of an intangible asset to be assumed to be zero unless:

li.p: there is a commitment by a third party to purchase the asset at the end of its useful life; or
there is an active market for the asset and:
the asset’s residual value can be determined by reference to that market; and
it is probable that such a market will exist at the end of the asset’s useful life.
